data.title: Kiriku und die Zauberin (1998)
data.meta_description: Kiriku und die Zauberin (1998) - Trivia on IMDb: Cameos, Mistakes, Spoilers and more...
data.text:
Director Trademark: [Michel Ocelot] [silhouettes] In one scene Kirikou's mother is seen as a solid black silhouette backlit by fire; later in the film, Kirikou himself, for the entirety of the underground tunnel scenes, is rendered as a black silhouette with only the whites of his eyes and teeth showing.

[Michel Ocelot] had first envisioned Kiriku und die Zauberin (1998) as a silhouette animation (the medium he had been working in since 1988's Cin√© si (1989)) and wrote the initial version of the screenplay with this manner of presentation in mind. Karaba's "breast jewelry" emerged during this phase as a device to prevent her having the appearance of having only one breast when her torso was turned to a three-quarter view but was retained despite the changeover to full color.
